column5: Open water fishing.  I can’t wait to get the boat out.  Within 8hrs of Toronto.  August September.   	can be any of Muskie pike bass pickerel lake trout  looking for action but where? Nip?

Try Gowganda . Lots of Pickeral,pike , bass and perch . Also lots of back lakes for trout , just about every type of fish no Musky . Gow-Bush-Kon Lodge  clean and comfrotable cabins , great boats at reasonable rates.
Ok it’s on the list thanks.  	I always bring my own boat.  	sleeping can be drive to camping.  Hotel.  Or fish camp.
Big Basswood Lake blind River Good lake trout
Hit Temagami Glen and just camp on one of the hundreds of Crown camp sites around the lake!
EXCEPT!!!  if i am there first
It would be very difficult for me to fit camping gear in my boat. 	two trips I guess.   	I’m looking at a few lakes. Nice to dream on a day too cold to be outside.

Easy enough and a few spots, including my point of land on the lake, that are close enough to the town launch that two trips wouldn't be a big deal. One site is even close enough you can slip over to the PPark and use the showers on the sly....
I've always wanted to try Abitibi and Temiskaming looks interesting as well.. both can be rewarding and challenging...
If musky is a must try the Ottawa River region,  not sure about lake trout though
Within 8 hours of Toronto you have fishing heaven ....From Lake St Clair to Lake Nippissing to Golden Lake...and everything in between and the best part is that is only about 5 hours out of Toronto.
St. Lawrence River from Kingston on down. Back lakes north of Kingston are also great areas to play with lodges and B&B all over the place
